definition: Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: Whenever you say” I love you”, please say it honestly.
sentences.chinese: 无论何时说“我爱你”，请真心实意。

sentences.english: We genuinely want to engage in consultation.
sentences.chinese: 我们真心实意希望进行磋商。

sentences.english: I never feel that that fellow is really sincere; he's too mealy- mouthed.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没感到那个家伙是真心实意的，他太油滑了。

sentences.english: God will not let you miss him if you are that serious about seeking him.
sentences.chinese: 如果你真心实意的去寻找上帝，上帝不会让你错过他。

sentences.english: Mr Obama’s affection for the people of the sprawling archipelago seemed heartfelt.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马对群岛人民的感情也显得真心实意。

sentences.english: The rich people honest, the brothers is sincere.
sentences.chinese: 富贵这人实诚，对兄弟是真心实意。

sentences.english: Whenever you say:I love you, please say honestly.
sentences.chinese: 无论何时说我爱你，请真心实意。

sentences.english: We genuinely want to know what others think,” Biden told leaders gathered in Vina del Mar, Chile, for the March 28 Progressive Governance Conference.
sentences.chinese: 我们真心实意希望知道别人在想什么。

sentences.english: Then she became terrified, and turned back and repented right heartily of her sin.
sentences.chinese: 她惊恐万分，立即转身，真心实意地为她的罪过忏悔。

definition: earnestly and sincerely (idiom); with all sincerity
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
to be totally devoted (to a person)
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
